OOC: the matrix isnt inside Rodimus is insinde of one minion I dont remembe=
r who


From: Sandy 
Sent: Friday, February 12, 2010 10:33 PM
To: nbwrpg@ya=
hoogroups.com 
Subject: Recovering Rodimus


  
From what Kenzo had told hi=
m, Tucson could now put two and two together and now realized that his rest=
oration abilities along with his skills as a warrior, would be needed more =
than ever. To him Restoration was more than just restoring artifacts, makin=
g them appear and work like new, it was also about restoring old programmin=
g and recovery of important data. He did not know the extent of the corrupt=
ion upon which was placed on Rodimus but he knew he couldn't just throw in =
the towel on his leader. Autobots stuck together, and through thick and thi=
n, he'd keep his pledge to never abandon his fellow Autobots. He also reali=
zed that if he was going to get anywhere, he'd have to do it himself. 

"On=
 second thought, I think I'll go this one alone. Don't wait up for me, I do=
n't think I'll be back too soon."

He bids Kenzo good bye and walks out of =
the room. 

"Oh before I forget, have the CR chamber prepared for Rodimus. =
He'll need it more than me." 

He was dead set on recovering his leader. An=
d this time, nothing and no one would get in his way of achieving his missi=
on. He sends one final message to Lord Perseus.

"Lord Perseus, it's come t=
o my attention that my leader, Rodimus Prime, has been abducted and altered=
 severely. This puts the Matrix of Leadership at a grave Risk, but most of =
all, his spark, which I believe is too precious to waste for evil purposes.=
 I can not abandon my leader, not even in his corruptive state. I hereby an=
nounce that I am on route to locating my leader, and I DO intend to BRING H=
IM BACK. Hopefully, the damage can be reversed. If not, there is question o=
f the well being of the Matrix. I must recover it, perhaps not for my own p=
ersonal gain, but for the benefit of Autobot kind. It's too precious to los=
e to the hands of those who thirst for power and greed. I swear by Primus's=
 name, I will return, but my return may not be a fast one. May Primus guide=
 you as he guides me. This is Tucson, signing off. I will report to you aga=
in, once I know more of the condition of my leader."

He signs off, gets of=
f the ship, and transforms into SUV mode, hoping to find Rodimus via his so=
nar systems.

Tag: Kraftlos and Cyclonus.
